creator: jon@latchkey.com
text:
I'm using Ubuntu 6.0.6. For some crazy reason they have a
/etc/apache2/ports.conf which doesn't have Listen 443 as default. 

For the second time now (yes I'm an idiot), I have configured a virtual host to
listen on 443 and have forgotten to put a Listen 443 into the ports.conf file. 

After banging my head against the wall for about an hour (two separate times
now), I finally realized that I was missing the Listen 443. So, it seems that it
would be nice if httpd could give me some sort of warning or error message if it
reads a NameVirtualHost *:443 in the configuration but doesn't have a Listen 443.

Thanks!

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: In 2.2 It already warns if there are no matching virtualhosts, and NVH is deprecated in trunk.
